result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mitchell Glen Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
09:37 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:   Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus, DF:  Mitchell Glen Anderson appeared from jail. INCLUDES 20CF938, 21CF128, 21CF160, 21CF237 and 22CF110. DA Anderson recites agreement. DE sworn. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Possession of Methamphetamine in 20CF938 and Ct 3 - Bail Jumping - Felony in 21CF128. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Possession of Methamphetamine in 20CF938 and Ct 3 - Bail Jumping - Felony in 21CF128. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 2 in 20CF938, Cts 1-2 and 4 in 21CF128, Ct 1 in 22CF110 and cases 21CF160, 21CF237 in their entirety. Court reads in and dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF110 for purposes of restitution. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. DE waives PSI. Adjourned: 10:04 AM. kma

Court orders:
20CF938
Ct 1 - Possession of Methamphetamine
S/W 3 years probation with conditions: 
- Absolute Sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Random testing required at least one time per month by Agent
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Court Costs $268; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through Clerk of Court
  

21CF128
Ct 3 - Bail Jumping - Felony
S/W 3 years probation with conditions: 
- Absolute Sobriety
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment
- Random testing required at least one time per month by Agent
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Restitution $15.38, payable to Kwik Trip in New Richmond; payable through Clerk of Court
- Court Costs $268; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $250; payable through Clerk of Court

33 days jail credit in the event of revocation.
Apply bond on file, payment plan approved or 60 DTP.
Defendant to register with probation today.
Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:20 AM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY: Dan Firkus, DF: Mitchell Glen Anderson appeared from jail. INCLUDES 20CF938, 21CF128, 21CF160, 21CF237 and 22CF110. Atty. Firkus states that an offer was received, requests additional time to discuss with DE. Court sets PTC with time to allow for PLEAS. Atty. Firkus notes request for bond modification filed on 22CF110. State objects to bond modification at this time. Atty. Firkus responds. Court denies bond modification at this time. Bond continues. Adjourned: 10:29 AM. kma  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
for Release/ Modification/ change in Sentence. Filed by DE. arc    Per SJN, Scheduled hearing for 04/07/22 at 10:15 AM.
Pre-trial conference on April 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Motion to Modify Bond. Filed by Atty Firkus. km               to kap

Preliminary hearing on March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am. Includes PTC: 20CF938, 21CF128, 21CF160, 21CF237 and PH 22CF110.

01:01 PM   Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: S. Fox, DA:  Karl E Anderson, DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi, DF:  Mitchell Glen Anderson appeared. Includes Return on warrant: 20CF938, 21CF128, 21CF160, 21CF237 and INIT 22CF110. QUASH WARRANTS. Court reviews files and notes Atty Firkus has been atty of record on a court ordered appt. Def does qualify for a Public Defender. RE INIT for 22CF110:  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Bond arguments. Def turned himself into Polk County approx. a month ago. Court administratively transfers 22CF110 to Branch I and schedules there.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
